p: Other conditions modifying blood lipid content in participants include: sex, age, diabetes or glucose intolerance, pregnancy or lactation, medication modifying blood lipid concentrations such as cholesterol- or TG-lowering drugs, obesity, athletes or highly active participants, menopause, and chronic or acute smoking ( 4, 44). For instance, smoking a single cigarette increases the metabolic rate of TG-rich lipoproteins ( 58).
